form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reid (for himself and Mr. Heller) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to include court security officers in the public safety officers’ death benefits program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stanley Cooper Death Benefits for Court Security Officers Act.
Section 1204(9) of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3796b(9)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C)(ii), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (D), by striking the period and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: a court security officer who is under contract with the United States Marshals Service.

section.text: There are authorized to be appropriated $1,000,000 for each fiscal year to carry out the amendments made by this Act.
The amendments made by this Act shall apply to any injury sustained on or after January 1, 2010.
